title: Edmonds matrix
summary: In graph theory, the Edmonds matrix A {\displaystyle A} of a balanced bipartite graph G = ( U , V , E ) {\displaystyle G=(U,V,E)} with sets of vertices U = { u 1 , u 2 , … , u n } {\displaystyle U=\{u_{1},u_{2},\dots ,u_{n}\}} and V = { v 1 , v 2 , … , v n } {\displaystyle V=\{v_{1},v_{2},\dots ,v_{n}\}} is defined by
